definition: to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)

sentences.english: A big advertising campaign to promote our new toothpaste.
sentences.chinese: 推销我厂新牙膏的一场大的广告宣传攻势。

sentences.english: State and local governments are readying their publicity machines.
sentences.chinese: 州政府和各地政府也都准备好了宣传攻势。

sentences.english: The North has also been angered by a renewed propaganda drive from the South.
sentences.chinese: 北方对来自南方的新一轮的宣传攻势，也感到恼怒。

sentences.english: Once Cold is granted asylum, the propaganda is dialed up.
sentences.chinese: 科尔德被允许避难之后，宣传攻势立即升级。

definition: to boost support or interest/to campaign/to promote
to have the power to rally supporters
lit. hiding the sky and covering the earth (idiom); fig. earth-shattering/omnipresent/of universal importance
to resist/to boycott/to refuse (to cooperate)/to reject/resistance/refusal
to push the wave and add to the billows (idiom); to add momentum/to encourage sth to get bigger/to add fuel to the fire
public praise/public reputation/commonly held opinions/current idiom
to build up public opinion/to create a fuss
